errorFetchQuestions: Error fetching questions. Please check your internet connection and AI provider settings.
errorAnalyzeResults: Error analyzing results. Please try again.
welcomeDescription: Welcome to the advanced political compass test. This test is designed in three levels to gradually analyze your views and provide a comprehensive overview of your political standing. Click the button below to begin.
shareText: I just took the Political Compass Test! My result is: {quadrant}. Find out yours!
shareApiNotSupported: Web Share API is not supported in your browser. Try copying the text!
aiProviderGeminiDescription: Uses the default Google AI Studio API key. No configuration needed.
aboutDesc1: This application is an advanced, multi-level political compass test designed to provide users with a detailed analysis of their political orientation.
aboutDesc2: It uses AI to generate dynamic, unbiased questions and to provide in-depth behavioral analysis based on the user's responses. The app is highly customizable, allowing users to change themes, fonts, and even the underlying AI model.
featureMultiLevel: Multi-level testing for progressively deeper analysis.
featureDynamicQuestions: AI-powered dynamic question generation ensures a unique test every time.
featureVisualResults: Interactive charts and detailed descriptions of results.
featureCustomizable: Fully customizable themes, fonts, and AI provider settings.
featureExport: Multiple export options (PNG, PDF, TXT, etc.) and sharing capabilities.
featureMultiLanguage: Fully bilingual interface supporting English and Farsi.
featureBots: Production-ready Telegram & Discord bots for multi-platform engagement.
galleryWelcomeCaption: The main screen with the settings panel open, showing customization options.
galleryQuizCaption: The quiz interface, showing a question and answer options.
galleryLoadingCaption: The loading screen displayed while the AI generates questions.
galleryResultsCaption: The detailed results page with the political compass chart and analysis.
deployIntroDescV2: This project contains two parts: a frontend web application and a backend for bots. This guide will walk you through deploying both to Cloudflare's powerful serverless platform.
deployFrontendCFLogin: Log in to the Cloudflare dashboard.
deployFrontendCFSelect: Go to `Workers & Pages` > `Create application` > `Pages` > `Connect to Git`.
deployFrontendCFConnect: Connect your GitHub repository and select the project.
deployFrontendCFSettings: In `Build settings`, use the following configuration:
deployFrontendCFDeploy: Click `Save and Deploy`. Your web app will be live!
deployBotsCreateTelegram: Create a new Telegram bot via
deployBotsCreateDiscord: Create a new application on the
deployBotsSaveDiscordIDs: Then, create a bot for it and save the `Application ID`, `Public Key`, and `Bot Token`.
deployWorkerGetCode: Open a terminal and get the application code from its repository.
deployWorkerKV: Create a KV Namespace for storing user sessions. Run:
deployWorkerKV2: You will get an `id` and a `preview_id`. Save them.
deployWorkerConfigUI: Go back to the web app, open the settings panel, and fill in the 'Bot Configuration' section with all your tokens and the KV IDs.
deployWorkerToml: Copy the generated `wrangler.toml` content from the app and paste it into the `wrangler.toml` file inside your `worker` directory.
deployWorkerSecrets: Copy the generated shell script commands and run them in your terminal to securely set your secret keys.
deployConnectGetURL: After deployment, you'll get a URL for your worker (e.g., `https://your-bot.your-user.workers.dev`).
deployConnectTelegram2: Set the webhook by running this command in your terminal, replacing the placeholders:
deployConnectDiscord2: In the Discord Developer Portal, go to your application's settings and paste your worker URL followed by `/discord` into the `Interactions Endpoint URL` field.
deployConnectDiscordCmd2: Run the following command to register the `/quiz` command with Discord. Replace placeholders:
deployConnectDiscordCmd3: You only need to run this once. Your secret is found in the `wrangler.toml` file.
deployDone: Congratulations! Your bots are now live and connected.
botConfigDescription: Configure and generate deployment files for your Telegram & Discord bots. Fill in the details below.
botConfigSecretDescription: A random secret to protect certain endpoints. You can generate one with `openssl rand -hex 16`.
botConfigTomlDescription: Copy this content into the `worker/wrangler.toml` file in your project.
botConfigSecretsDescription: Run these commands in your terminal from the `worker` directory to set your secrets.
